Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http

Interface WebSocketSession

  • public interface WebSocketSession
    A WebSocket session for sending messages to the peer.

    This interface is provided to WebSocketEventHandler.opened(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.WebSocketSession) when a WebSocket connection is established. Use it to send messages and control the connection lifecycle.

    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    WebSocketEventHandler

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void close()
      Closes the WebSocket connection with a normal closure code (1000).
      void close​(int code, java.lang.String reason)
      Closes the WebSocket connection with the specified code and reason.
      boolean isOpen()
      Returns whether this session is open and ready for communication.
      void sendBinary​(java.nio.ByteBuffer data)
      Sends a binary message to the peer.
      void sendPing​(java.nio.ByteBuffer payload)
      Sends a ping frame to the peer.
      void sendText​(java.lang.String message)
      Sends a text message to the peer.

    • Method Detail

      • sendText

        void sendText​(java.lang.String message)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a text message to the peer.
        Parameters:
        message - the text message to send
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the session is not open

      • sendBinary

        void sendBinary​(java.nio.ByteBuffer data)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a binary message to the peer.
        Parameters:
        data - the binary data to send
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the session is not open

      • sendPing

        void sendPing​(java.nio.ByteBuffer payload)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a ping frame to the peer.

        The peer should respond with a pong frame containing the same payload. This can be used for keep-alive or latency measurement.

        Parameters:
        payload - optional payload data (may be null, max 125 bytes)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if payload exceeds 125 bytes
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the session is not open

      • close

        void close()
    throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the WebSocket connection with a normal closure code (1000).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • close

        void close​(int code,
           java.lang.String reason)
    throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the WebSocket connection with the specified code and reason.
        Parameters:
        code - the close code (1000-4999)
        reason - optional close reason (may be null)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • isOpen

        boolean isOpen()
        Returns whether this session is open and ready for communication.
        Returns:
        true if the session is open
